channel.description: Recent content in networking on James Moriarty

item.title: TCP Nagle's Delay
item.description: Someone recently asked me to help diagnose a mysterious delay on a globally deployed Elixir service.

item.title: TCP Anycast Shift
item.description: What happens when routing changes for a stateful network protocol and unexpectedly arrives at a device without a session?

item.title: Docker and DLNA
item.description: I’ve recently discovered the Docker network macvlan driver. Itâ€™s a very lightweight driver, because rather than using any Linux bridging or port mapping, it connects container interfaces directly to host interfaces.

item.title: Kubernetes and DLNA
item.description: These are some notes taken while deploying a Digital Living Network Alliance (DLNA) to Kubernetes.

item.title: HTTP Connect By Example
item.description: HTTP CONNECT is used to establish a tunnel. Tunnels are commonly used to create an end-to-end virtual connection, through one or more proxies, which can then be secured using TLS (Transport Layer Security).

item.title: AWS NAT Internet Egress
item.description: My work often involves restricted private networks often found in large enterprises.
